title: Arrays and Loops
description: Master arrays and learn how to loop through them.

segments.title: Working with Arrays
segments.content:
Introduction to Arrays

An array is a special variable, which can hold more than one value at a time. If you have a list of items (a list of car names, for example), storing the cars in single variables could look like this: let car1 = 'Saab'; let car2 = 'Volvo';

However, what if you want to loop through the cars and find a specific one? And what if you had not 2, but 200 cars? The solution is an array!

Example:

let cars = ['Saab', 'Volvo', 'BMW'];

You can access an element by referring to its index number: let firstCar = cars[0];

segments.title: Looping through Arrays
segments.content:
For Loops

Loops are handy if you want to run the same code over and over again, each time with a different value.

The for loop is often the tool you will use when you want to iterate over an array.

Example:

for (let i = 0; i < cars.length; i++) { text += cars[i] + '
'; }
